Text:
You are a novice swordsman, traveling through the dangerous land of
Fethrir.

Game Over. You are dead.
Nice try buddy.

End of the current version.
 Congrats for beating the game!

You are only wielding a rusty sword, but despite that you are filled with
courage!
On your way to the castle of Mirihidor, you encounter a wandering goblin.

He is not that scary and you can choose to ignore him,but he has shiny
boots that could sell well in the castle.

Do you wish to:
A: Ignore the goblin and continue forward
B: Battle the goblin
You decide to ignore the goblin.
You rush to the goblin, sure of your victory
In your inability to decide, the goblin sees you and decide to attack you.

How do you wish to obliterate the goblin?
A: Your sword
B: Magic

Using your rusty sword, you slice and dice the goblin easily.
The shiny boots are yours!

Magic? You don't know any magic you are a warrior!
Trying your best to cast a spell, you look dangerous enough to scare the
goblin away.
Goodbye shiny boots...

You are not using your sword, nor magic!
The goblin is not weirded out by your inaction.
He rushes at you and stab you in the chest!
You quickly arrive in the castle, without much other action on your way.
